intro: Geniostephanus tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly stephanus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
